meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Welcome back to my groovy gaming hub! Today, I'm here to give you the scoop on Zenless Zone Zero (ZZZ), the latest gacha action RPG from HoYoverse. Now, I know what you're thinking: "Gacha" and "RPG" can be a bit of a snooze-fest, but trust me, folks, ZZZ is a wild ride.

As I dived into the world of New Eridu, I was immediately struck by its trippy, 1990s-inspired aesthetic. It's like stepping into a time machine and landing in the midst of a futuristic rave – complete with pulsing neon lights, retro synths, and an unmistakable dash of cassette-tape nostalgia. Who wouldn't want to explore this strange, new world?

But let's get to the good stuff: combat. Oh boy, oh boy! It's like HoYoverse took all the best bits from their other hit titles – Genshin Impact and Honkai Impact – and distilled them into a super-charged, fast-paced battle system that never gets old. I mean, where else can you chain together multiple combos while simultaneously dodging laser beams and taking down robotic foes? Nowhere, that's where!

Now, I know some of my fellow critics might say ZZZ is a bit too reliant on its gacha mechanics (Twinfinite, Voxel, and IGN, I'm looking at you), but hey, what's wrong with a little bit of loot-and-grind action every now and then? It's all part of the fun, folks! And besides, the game does an excellent job of balancing progression with exploration. You can spend hours just soaking up the atmosphere, completing quests, and – of course – battling to your heart's content.

So, what are my thoughts on ZZZ? Well, I think it's a real treat for fans of the gacha RPG genre. It's a game that wears its heart on its sleeve (or should I say, on its cassette tape?), with a unique blend of style and substance that'll keep you coming back for more.

In conclusion, Hippo Penny gives you: Zenless Zone Zero – it's a blast!
